result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monique L. Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Monique L. Jones in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Monique L. Jones.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a motion hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment due to difficulties in obtaining some video discovery.  Court rescheduled motion hearing as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. STATES RESPONSE MOTION

Defendant Monique L. Jones in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a motion hearing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court ordered State's reponse to be filed by September 26, 2022.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Filed and forwarded to Judge for review

Defendant Monique L. Jones in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. Defense has discovery and an offer. Defense will be filing an evidentiary motion. Court sets deadline to file for 07/18/2022 by 5:00 pm. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Monique L. Jones in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Michael Steinle received and filed

Adjustment Number: 22A 038477,

Receipt Number: 22RP016185,
Amount: $20.00
OFF THE RECORD- Email correspondence with parties. Court vacates 04/19/2022 indigency hearing and schedules case for a Preliminary Hearing in prelim court on 04/26/2022 at 08:30 AM.
Indigency hearing on April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Monique L. Jones in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant previously posted $5,700 cash bail. Court orders $1,000 cash bail remain and the rest be returned to the remitter. 
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Monique L. Jones in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
